name: Drip Coffee Maker
description: Done by allowing hot water to evenly saturate coffee grounds. Ideal for those who prefer a convenient and consistent brewing method.

name: Espresso
description: This manual method provides a strong base for various coffee drinks like lattes and cappuccinos.

name: French Press
description: Immerse coffee grounds in hot water to create a rich brew.

name: Pour Over
description: Done through precise pouring. This manual pour-over method offers control over various aspects of brewing.

name: AeroPress
description: A more versatile manual brewing method as it combines immersion and pressure to produce a smooth and rich coffee with customizable intensity.

name: Cold Brew
description: Done through steeping coarse coffee grounds in cold water for an extended period, resulting in a refreshing drink.

name: Turkish Coffee
description: Finely ground coffee, water, and sugar (optional) are simmered in a special pot, producing a strong and aromatic drink.

name: Moka Pot
description: Produces a strong coffee similar to espresso, but not as concentrated.

name: Siphon (Vacuum Pot)
description: A more visual and aesthetic brewing process that creates an exceptional and clean cup of coffee.

name: Single-Serve Coffee Pods
description: Ideal for quick and consistent cups of coffee with minimal effort and cleanup.
